content: I made a meeting "proposal" for the (already approved) meeting this friday, as well as an agenda
@nikomatsakis ^

and also @Santiago Pastorino ^ ; the prep work that wg-prioritization does for T-compiler triage seems potentially relevant here, in terms of roughly matching what I was trying to fill in for Friday's agenda. (Except that for Friday's meeting, I am hoping for deeper dives in the necessary cases.)
I'm confused about one thing, @pnkfelix, did you expect to do this during the usual slot?
the Friday slot, you mean?
oh, I guess you did, never mind
The meeting is scheduled for that slot, yeah
early I remember there being some kind of weird calendar event that was like an "all day" event
but maybe I misremembered or you changed it
/me doesn't remember
I'm traveling but I think I can still dial in and attend the meeting. I'll make sure to mute myself so there's no extra noise.
hmm. @nikomatsakis did you create a zoom meeting for this?
(I vaguely remember talking about the fact that I couldn't make zoom mtgs on mozilla's zoom anymore, but I cannot remember if niko actually said they would create the zoom invite.)
but since I'm not seeing any responses from niko, I'll just make a meeting on my own zoom account now. :)
https://zoom.us/j/92020558500
oh and let me go ahead and ping @T-compiler/meeting to remind everyone that this meeting is happening! :)
are you going to be able to join the zoom, @Santiago Pastorino ?
yeah, just figured that was on zoom, gonna join but I'm not able to participate 100%
thats okay
was hoping to have time to do this today but it's a busy day at work, hope everyone has a productive meeting
ping to @simulacrum : did you manage to revert PR #70793 ?
not yet
I am about to hop on zoom fwiw
ack!
I'm sorry, some stuff came up locally
I can join
Build hang on Linux #76980
smissing_fragment_specifier hard error in Rust 1.47 #76605
Breaking change/regression in nightly? Hash of Discriminant now produces different results across CPU architectures #74215

enum Foo { X = 0xffff_ffff_ffff }

@pnkfelix ^^ this errors or truncates for 32-bit targets
:sad:
an erorr there seems fine. Truncation sounds ... unfortunate
but if you use #[repr(uN)] it becomes target-independent
I do think this was useful fwiw
AV meetings work for me, but as previously noted it can be hard for some people to understand and write fast enough
it was nice for me to engage again with Rust things (the past few months have been... weird)
it was useful in my opinion, today in particular wasn't able to participate very actively, but I think the space is useful
(aside, could we have our tooling ping all issues tagged as nightly regressions when we cut beta so a human is reminded to retag if appropriate, we had a lot of double guessing around bad tags today)
and the time we are leaving until the next release seems also perfect to me

Esteban K端ber said:

(aside, could we have our tooling ping all issues tagged as nightly regressions when we cut beta so a human is reminded to retag if appropriate, we had a lot of double guessing around bad tags today)

I'd love if we can do that, I was told that wg-triage is the one that usually go over these things
but if I recall correctly @simulacrum have said that this is manually done
and often from time to time all of us miss some retags
we wg-prioritization have realized about some misses and changes them but often we also fail and @pnkfelix is the one that figures that out :)
I do not think anyone does this today
I have a longstanding todo to implement the auto-rollover that @Esteban K端ber mentions (or something like it) in triagebot, but time has been scarce lately.
It would be lovely. I think we're all starved for time lately :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
at least it's much much easier to figure out when a PR landed now :)
(though backports still require manual work which I want to fix)
I thought the meeting seemed useful, though for various reasons I was not able to actively participate as much as I would like.
Re: zoom, as usual, it permits higher bandwidth, but at a price. I don't know overall
(deleted)

one thing is that the meeting effectively became an audio-only one, rather than audio+video. I can see benefits to that (in terms of people feeling more free to take the meeting while otherwise engaged (e.g. preparnig a meal). But of course a big reason to have video is to have non-auditory feedback cues....
imo for the purposes of meetings like this, audio-only is sufficient
